item.title: 投资者押注美欧通胀将出现 2022 年以来最剧烈分化
item.description: 押注未来通胀走势的交易员预计，受不同的增长路径、关税威胁以及潜在的乌克兰和平协议后欧洲能源价格更低等因素的影响，美国和欧元区之间的通胀走势将出现三年来最大的分化。【原文：Traders who bet on the future course of inflation foresee the sharpest divergence for three years between the U.S. and euro zone, driven by different growth paths, tariff threats and cheaper European energy after a potential Ukraine peace deal.】

item.title: 俄罗斯电子商务公司 Ozon 公布 2024 年盈利增长超过 500
item.description: 俄罗斯电子商务公司 Ozon 周四报告称，受市场业务货币化程度提高和金融技术服务扩展的帮助，全年核心盈利飙升 500%以上，达到 401 亿卢布（约合 4.5934 亿美元）。【原文：Russian e-commerce firm Ozon on Thursday reported a more than 500% jump in full-year core earnings to 40.1 billion roubles ($459.34 million), helped by the improved monetisation of marketplace operations and expansion of its fintech services.】

item.title: 日本邮政银行将进行最多 42.2 亿美元的二次股票发行
item.description: 日本邮政控股公司（Japan Post Holdings）周四提交的一份监管文件显示，该公司计划出售其在日本邮政银行（Japan Post Bank）的股份，二次股票出售价值高达 6300 亿日元（42.2 亿美元）。【原文：Japan Post Holdings plans to sell its shares in Japan Post Bank in a secondary share sale worth as much as 630 billion yen ($4.22 billion), a regulatory filing showed on Thursday.】

item.title: Aixtron 预计 2025 年收入低于去年水平
item.description: 德国芯片系统制造商 Aixtron 公司周四表示，由于市场环境充满挑战，该公司预计 2025 年的收入将低于去年的水平。【原文：German chip systems manufacturer Aixtron expects its 2025 revenue to come in below last year's level, it said on Thursday citing a challenging market environment.】

item.title: 法国泰希尼布公司第四季度营收超预期，建议将股息上调 49
item.description: 法国基础设施和技术公司 Technip Energies 周四公布的第四季度销售额超出市场预期，并提议将股息上调 49%。【原文：French infrastructure and technology company Technip Energies on Thursday proposed a 49% dividend increase, as it reported fourth-quarter sales ahead of market expectations.】

item.title: 瓦卢瑞克核心利润因北美钢管价格下跌而下降
item.description: 法国冶金集团瓦卢瑞克（Vallourec）周四报告称，其第四季度核心利润下降了 23.6%，原因是其北美钢管业务的平均销售价格下降。【原文：French metallurgical group Vallourec reported a 23.6% drop in its fourth quarter core profit on Thursday, citing lower average selling prices in its North American tubes business.】

item.title: 瑞士再保险公司预计洛杉矶野火造成的损失不到 7 亿美元
item.description: 瑞士再保险公司（Swiss Re）周四表示，洛杉矶野火造成的索赔额将少于 7 亿美元，并将对其第一季度业绩产生影响。【原文：Reinsurance company Swiss Re said on Thursday that claims from wildfires in Los Angeles would be less than $700 million and would impact its first quarter results.】

item.title: 消息称日产将于 3 月 12 日宣布精简高管阵容
item.description: 据三位熟知内情的人士透露，日产汽车预计将于 3 月 12 日宣布一项精简高管阵容的计划。【原文：Nissan Motor is expected to announce a planned streamlining of its executive line-up on March 12, according to three people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国例外论的交易为何摇摇欲坠
item.description: 今年年初，投资者押注唐纳德-特朗普总统的政策将刺激美国股市和美元跑赢全球同行。这一假设正日益经受考验。【原文：Going into the year investors were betting that President Donald Trump's policies would spur U.S. stocks and the dollar to outperform their global peers. That assumption is increasingly getting tested.】

item.title: 消息人士称，中国百度将于 3 月中旬推出升级版人工智能厄尼模型
item.description: 一位直接了解此事的消息人士称，中国百度将于3月中旬推出下一代人工智能模型 "厄尼"，该模型在推理等方面的能力将得到提升。【原文：China's Baidu will launch the next generation of its artificial intelligence model Ernie in mid-March, which will see improved capabilities in areas such as reasoning, a source with direct knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 台湾部长称台积电海外合资企业需政府许可
item.description: 台湾经济部长郭台铭（Kuo Jyh-huei）周四表示，芯片制造商台积电的任何海外合资企业都需要政府许可，但政府不会干涉其决定。【原文：Taiwan Economy Minister Kuo Jyh-huei said on Thursday that chipmaker TSMC would need government permission for any overseas joint ventures, but the government will not interfere in its decisions.】

item.title: 早间竞价特朗普关税成焦点，英伟达冷热不均
item.description: 凯文-巴克兰对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Kevin Buckland】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，梅赛德斯-奔驰计划在中国裁员 15
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四援引熟悉内情的人士的话报道，梅赛德斯-奔驰及其子公司正计划在中国裁员达 15%。【原文：Mercedes-Benz and its subsidiaries are planning to cut up to 15% of their workforce in China, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 金融时报》报道：中国限制本土公司在美上市
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周四报道，中国证券监管机构已经取缔了在美国证券交易所上市的小型本土公司，因为其中许多公司成为操纵价格的工具，给美国投资者造成了重大损失。【原文：China's securities regulator has clamped down on small homegrown companies listing on U.S. stock exchanges after many of them became vehicles for price-rigging, causing heavy losses for U.S. investors, the Financial Times reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 丰田汽车 1 月份全球产量一年来首次增长
item.description: 丰田汽车公司周四表示，1月份全球产量出现一年来的首次增长，这是因为该公司在日本国内市场从去年的认证丑闻中恢复过来后提高了产量。【原文：Toyota Motor said on Thursday its worldwide production rose for the first time in a year in January, as it ramped up output in Japan after recovering from last year's certification scandal in its home market.】

item.title: 随着电视机和吸尘器制造商采用 DeepSeek 的人工智能模型，中国的 DeepSeek 热潮进入了家庭领域
item.description: 中国对 DeepSeek 的热烈追捧又向前迈进了一步--扩展到了电视、冰箱和机器人吸尘器，许多家电品牌宣布它们的产品将采用这家初创公司的人工智能模型。【原文：China's joyful embrace of DeepSeek has gone one step deeper - extending to TVs, fridges and robot vacuum cleaners with a slew of home appliance brands announcing that their products will feature the startup's artificial intelligence models.】

item.title: 铁矿石因进口增加和中国钢铁出口担忧而下滑
item.description: 铁矿石期货价格周四下跌超过 1%，受针对中国钢铁的关税措施不断升级以及头号消费国中国铁矿石进口量增加的打压。【原文：Iron ore futures prices dropped more than 1% on Thursday, pressured by escalating tariff measures against Chinese steel and an increase in iron ore imports into top consumer China.】

item.title: 劳斯莱斯印第安纳工厂的 UAW 成员达成临时协议
item.description: 联合汽车工人工会主席肖恩-费恩（Shawn Fain）周三表示，代表劳斯莱斯印第安纳波利斯地方 933 部门的工会成员与该公司达成了临时协议。【原文：The United Auto Workers union's president Shawn Fain said on Wednesday its members representing Rolls Royce's Indianapolis Local 933 unit reached a tentative agreement with the company.】

item.title: 贝莱德将在估值紧张、增长乏力的情况下重新评估澳大利亚的风险敞口
item.description: 全球最大的资产管理公司贝莱德（BlackRock）周四表示，由于估值紧张和增长乏力，该公司正在考虑将重点从澳大利亚转移到美国和日本等其他市场，以寻求更好的机会。【原文：BlackRock , the world's largest asset manager, said on Thursday it was considering shifting focus away from Australia due to stretched valuations and weak growth, eyeing better opportunities in other markets like the U.S. and Japan.】

item.title: 路透社调查显示，由于经济承受能力受到影响，澳大利亚房价今年仅会小幅上涨
item.description: 路透社对房地产分析师进行的一项民意调查显示，澳大利亚今年的房价上涨速度将低于此前的预期，进一步降息只会带来适度的支持。【原文：Home prices in Australia will rise less quickly this year than previously thought, with only modest support from further interest rate cuts, according to a Reuters poll of property analysts.】

item.title: 美元因美国贸易政策焦虑而走强；英伟达对股市影响不大
item.description: 美元在周四亚洲早盘时段走强，原因是国债收益率走高，同时投资者对唐纳德-特朗普总统领导下的关税和经济前景进行了评估。【原文：The U.S. dollar firmed in early Asian hours on Thursday as Treasury yields ticked higher while investors assessed the outlook for tariffs and the economy under President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 加拿大监管机构将向谷歌征收在线新闻法运营成本费
item.description: 加拿大监管机构周三表示，将向谷歌征收费用，以收回执行一项要求大型互联网平台为其网站上的新闻内容付费的法律的成本。【原文：A Canadian regulator said on Wednesday it will impose a fee on Google to recover the cost of enforcing a law that requires large internet platforms to pay for news content on their websites.】

item.title: 特朗普砍掉雪佛龙委内瑞拉许可证，油价从两个月低点攀升
item.description: 周四，在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布撤销雪佛龙公司（Chevron）在委内瑞拉的运营许可、可能导致原油供应紧张之后，油价从两个月低点回升。【原文：Oil prices edged up from two-month lows on Thursday after U.S. President Donald Trump announced a reversal of a license given to Chevron to operate in Venezuela, potentially tightening crude supply.】

item.title: 特朗普在关税问题上不断变化的信息引发不确定性，美元走强
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普含糊地承诺对欧洲征收关税，以及进一步推迟对加拿大和墨西哥的征税计划，加剧了不确定性，美元周四在11周低点上方走强。【原文：The U.S. dollar firmed above an 11-week trough on Thursday as vague pledges from President Donald Trump to impose tariffs on Europe and further delays to levies planned for Canada and Mexico stoked uncertainty.】

item.title: 美国对委内瑞拉石油部门的许可和授权
item.description: 自 2019 年首次对委内瑞拉能源行业实施制裁以来，美国已向一些石油公司颁发了个别许可证，允许它们向特定目的地出口南美国家的石油。【原文：Since it first imposed sanctions on Venezuela's energy sector in 2019, the United States has granted individual licenses to some oil companies that allow them to export the South American country's oil to specific destinations.】

item.title: 澳大利亚第四季度商业投资下滑 0.2%，不及预期
item.description: 由于采矿业和建筑业的回落超过了数据中心的增长，澳大利亚商业投资在 12 月份意外下滑，这表明经济增长受到轻微拖累。【原文：Australian business investment unexpectedly dipped in the December quarter as a pullback in mining and construction outweighed strength in data centres, suggesting a slight drag on economic growth.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉原油在美国的最大买家
item.description: 美国能源信息署的数据显示，2024 年前 11 个月，美国从委内瑞拉进口的原油平均为 22.2 万桶/日，成为美国第四大原油供应国。【原文：U.S. imports of crude oil from Venezuela averaged 222,000 barrels per day (bpd) in the first 11 months of 2024, according to U.S. Energy Information Administration data, making it the fourth largest crude supplier to the United States.】

item.title: 彭博社称日产考虑更换首席执行官内田
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四援引熟悉情况的消息人士的话报道，日产汽车正在考虑更换首席执行官内田诚，以应对日益恶化的经营业绩以及与本田汽车就成立联合控股公司谈判的失败。【原文：Nissan Motor is considering replacing its CEO Makoto Uchida in response to the deteriorating business performance and the failure of negotiations with Honda Motor to establish a joint holding company, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday citing sources familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 联邦调查局称朝鲜应为价值 15 亿美元的 ByBit 黑客攻击负责
item.description: 美国联邦调查局周三表示，朝鲜对加密货币交易所 ByBit 约 15 亿美元虚拟资产被盗负有责任。【原文：The Federal Bureau of Investigation said on Wednesday that North Korea was responsible for the theft of approximately $1.5 billion in virtual assets from cryptocurrency exchange ByBit.】

item.title: 据《信息报》报道，Instagram 或将推出独立应用程序 Reels
item.description: 据 Information 周三援引一位知情人士的话报道，Instagram 首席执行官亚当-莫塞里（Adam Mosseri）本周告诉员工，Instagram 正在考虑为其短视频功能 Reels 推出一款独立应用。【原文：Instagram is considering the launch of a separate app for its short-form video feature, Reels, its chief Adam Mosseri told staff this week, the Information reported on Wednesday, citing a person who heard the remarks.】
